title: How to Tidy New Zealand Flax Plants

steps.headline: Remove any dead, browned, or damaged foliage as close to the base of the plant as possible.
steps.description: Use a sharp garden knife to do this if you can.

steps.headline: Remove all the cut pieces and compost or put out with garden waste.
Feed the plant with a nitrogen-rich fertilizer.

text: Cut back any flower spikes.  Remove any dead, browned, or damaged foliage as close to the base of the plant as possible. Use a sharp garden knife to do this if you can. Remove all the cut pieces and compost or put out with garden waste.  Feed the plant with a nitrogen-rich fertilizer.
